places_to_visit.name: The Colosseum
places_to_visit.description: The Colosseum is an ancient amphitheater located in the center of Rome. Built in the 1st century AD, it hosted gladiatorial contests and public spectacles. It remains one of Rome's most iconic landmarks and a testament to Roman engineering.

places_to_visit.name: Roman Forum
places_to_visit.description: The Roman Forum was the center of daily life in ancient Rome, hosting public meetings, triumphal processions, and criminal trials. Today, it is an extensive archaeological site offering insight into Rome's political and social history.

places_to_visit.name: Pantheon
places_to_visit.description: The Pantheon is a well-preserved ancient Roman temple, now a church, known for its impressive dome and oculus. Originally built by Marcus Agrippa and later rebuilt by Emperor Hadrian, it is a masterpiece of Roman architecture.
